html: Whether statues of wood and clay that ostensibly represent the true God, or sophisticated inventions fabricated of modern materials of which ancient idols are a type, none can be relied on to perform a saving role. The moment one entertains that idea he already repudiates the only Savior-God. Isn’t it solemn mockery and a desecration of Jehovah’s reality—which resembles nothing made by human hands—to fashion mere images of him or to supplant him in their lives with manmade objects so that even the prophets’ parodies of helpless idols seem unable to break their spell (Deuteronomy 4:23-25)?
